CreateRemoteAccessSession.name: CreateRemoteAccessSession
CreateRemoteAccessSession.documentation: Specifies and starts a remote access session.

DeleteDevicePool.name: DeleteDevicePool
DeleteDevicePool.documentation: Deletes a device pool given the pool ARN. Does not allow deletion of curated pools owned by the system.

DeleteProject.name: DeleteProject
DeleteProject.documentation:
Deletes an AWS Device Farm project, given the project ARN.

Note Deleting this resource does not stop an in-progress run.

DeleteRemoteAccessSession.name: DeleteRemoteAccessSession
DeleteRemoteAccessSession.documentation: Deletes a completed remote access session and its results.

DeleteRun.name: DeleteRun
DeleteRun.documentation:
Deletes the run, given the run ARN.

Note Deleting this resource does not stop an in-progress run.

DeleteUpload.name: DeleteUpload
DeleteUpload.documentation: Deletes an upload given the upload ARN.

GetAccountSettings.name: GetAccountSettings
GetAccountSettings.documentation: Returns the number of unmetered iOS and/or unmetered Android devices that have been purchased by the account.

GetDevice.name: GetDevice
GetDevice.documentation: Gets information about a unique device type.

GetDevicePoolCompatibility.name: GetDevicePoolCompatibility
GetDevicePoolCompatibility.documentation: Gets information about compatibility with a device pool.

GetOfferingStatus.name: GetOfferingStatus
GetOfferingStatus.documentation: Gets the current status and future status of all offerings purchased by an AWS account. The response indicates how many offerings are currently available and the offerings that will be available in the next period. The API returns a NotEligible error if the user is not permitted to invoke the operation. Please contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

GetRemoteAccessSession.name: GetRemoteAccessSession
GetRemoteAccessSession.documentation: Returns a link to a currently running remote access session.

InstallToRemoteAccessSession.name: InstallToRemoteAccessSession
InstallToRemoteAccessSession.documentation: Installs an application to the device in a remote access session. For Android applications, the file must be in .apk format. For iOS applications, the file must be in .ipa format.

ListNetworkProfiles.name: ListNetworkProfiles
ListNetworkProfiles.documentation: Returns the list of available network profiles.

ListOfferingPromotions.name: ListOfferingPromotions
ListOfferingPromotions.documentation: Returns a list of offering promotions. Each offering promotion record contains the ID and description of the promotion. The API returns a NotEligible error if the caller is not permitted to invoke the operation. Contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

ListOfferingTransactions.name: ListOfferingTransactions
ListOfferingTransactions.documentation: Returns a list of all historical purchases, renewals, and system renewal transactions for an AWS account. The list is paginated and ordered by a descending timestamp (most recent transactions are first). The API returns a NotEligible error if the user is not permitted to invoke the operation. Please contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

ListOfferings.name: ListOfferings
ListOfferings.documentation: Returns a list of products or offerings that the user can manage through the API. Each offering record indicates the recurring price per unit and the frequency for that offering. The API returns a NotEligible error if the user is not permitted to invoke the operation. Please contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

ListRemoteAccessSessions.name: ListRemoteAccessSessions
ListRemoteAccessSessions.documentation: Returns a list of all currently running remote access sessions.

ListRuns.name: ListRuns
ListRuns.documentation: Gets information about runs, given an AWS Device Farm project ARN.

ListSamples.name: ListSamples
ListSamples.documentation: Gets information about samples, given an AWS Device Farm project ARN

ListUploads.name: ListUploads
ListUploads.documentation: Gets information about uploads, given an AWS Device Farm project ARN.

PurchaseOffering.name: PurchaseOffering
PurchaseOffering.documentation: Immediately purchases offerings for an AWS account. Offerings renew with the latest total purchased quantity for an offering, unless the renewal was overridden. The API returns a NotEligible error if the user is not permitted to invoke the operation. Please contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

RenewOffering.name: RenewOffering
RenewOffering.documentation: Explicitly sets the quantity of devices to renew for an offering, starting from the effectiveDate of the next period. The API returns a NotEligible error if the user is not permitted to invoke the operation. Please contact aws-devicefarm-support@amazon.com if you believe that you should be able to invoke this operation.

StopRun.name: StopRun
StopRun.documentation: Initiates a stop request for the current test run. AWS Device Farm will immediately stop the run on devices where tests have not started executing, and you will not be billed for these devices. On devices where tests have started executing, Setup Suite and Teardown Suite tests will run to completion before stopping execution on those devices. You will be billed for Setup, Teardown, and any tests that were in progress or already completed.

UpdateDevicePool.name: UpdateDevicePool
UpdateDevicePool.documentation: Modifies the name, description, and rules in a device pool given the attributes and the pool ARN. Rule updates are all-or-nothing, meaning they can only be updated as a whole (or not at all).

UpdateNetworkProfile.name: UpdateNetworkProfile
UpdateNetworkProfile.documentation: Updates the network profile with specific settings.

UpdateProject.name: UpdateProject
UpdateProject.documentation: Modifies the specified project name, given the project ARN and a new name.

awsAccountNumber.documentation: The AWS account number specified in the AccountSettings container.

unmeteredDevices.documentation: Returns the unmetered devices you have purchased or want to purchase.

unmeteredRemoteAccessDevices.documentation: Returns the unmetered remote access devices you have purchased or want to purchase.

maxJobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The maximum number of minutes a test run will execute before it times out.

trialMinutes.documentation: Information about an AWS account's usage of free trial device minutes.

maxSlots.documentation: The maximum number of device slots that the AWS account can purchase. Each maximum is expressed as an offering-id:number pair, where the offering-id represents one of the IDs returned by the ListOfferings command.

defaultJobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The default number of minutes (at the account level) a test run will execute before it times out. Default value is 60 minutes.

AccountSettings.documentation: A container for account-level settings within AWS Device Farm.

type.documentation:
The artifact's type.

Allowed values include the following:

  • UNKNOWN: An unknown type.

  • SCREENSHOT: The screenshot type.

  • DEVICE_LOG: The device log type.

  • MESSAGE_LOG: The message log type.

  • RESULT_LOG: The result log type.

  • SERVICE_LOG: The service log type.

  • WEBKIT_LOG: The web kit log type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION_OUTPUT: The instrumentation type.

  • EXERCISER_MONKEY_OUTPUT: For Android, the artifact (log) generated by an Android fuzz test.

  • CALABASH_JSON_OUTPUT: The Calabash JSON output type.

  • CALABASH_PRETTY_OUTPUT: The Calabash pretty output type.

  • CALABASH_STANDARD_OUTPUT: The Calabash standard output type.

  • CALABASH_JAVA_XML_OUTPUT: The Calabash Java XML output type.

  • AUTOMATION_OUTPUT: The automation output type.

  • APPIUM_SERVER_OUTPUT: The Appium server output type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_OUTPUT: The Appium Java output type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_XML_OUTPUT: The Appium Java XML output type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON_OUTPUT: The Appium Python output type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON_XML_OUTPUT: The Appium Python XML output type.

  • EXPLORER_EVENT_LOG: The Explorer event log output type.

  • EXPLORER_SUMMARY_LOG: The Explorer summary log output type.

  • APPLICATION_CRASH_REPORT: The application crash report output type.

  • XCTEST_LOG: The XCode test output type.

url.documentation: The pre-signed Amazon S3 URL that can be used with a corresponding GET request to download the artifact's file.

Artifact.documentation: Represents the output of a test. Examples of artifacts include logs and screenshots.

architecture.documentation: The CPU's architecture, for example x86 or ARM.

clock.documentation: The clock speed of the device's CPU, expressed in hertz (Hz). For example, a 1.2 GHz CPU is expressed as 1200000000.

CPU.documentation:
Represents the amount of CPU that an app is using on a physical device.

Note that this does not represent system-wide CPU usage.

projectArn.documentation: The ARN of the project for the device pool.

CreateDevicePoolRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the create device pool operation.

CreateDevicePoolResult.documentation: Represents the result of a create device pool request.

projectArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to create a network profile.

name.documentation: The name you wish to specify for the new network profile.

type.documentation: The type of network profile you wish to create. Valid values are listed below.

uplinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

downlinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

uplinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of transmitted packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

downlinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of received packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

networkProfile.documentation: The network profile that is returned by the create network profile request.

defaultJobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: Sets the execution timeout value (in minutes) for a project. All test runs in this project will use the specified execution timeout value unless overridden when scheduling a run.

CreateProjectRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the create project operation.

CreateProjectResult.documentation: Represents the result of a create project request.

billingMethod.documentation: Returns the billing method for purposes of configuring a remote access session.

CreateRemoteAccessSessionConfiguration.documentation: Creates the configuration settings for a remote access session, including the device model and type.

projectArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to create a remote access session.

deviceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device for which you want to create a remote access session.

name.documentation: The name of the remote access session that you wish to create.

configuration.documentation: The configuration information for the remote access session request.

CreateRemoteAccessSessionRequest.documentation: Creates and submits a request to start a remote access session.

remoteAccessSession.documentation: A container that describes the remote access session when the request to create a remote access session is sent.

CreateRemoteAccessSessionResult.documentation: Represents the server response from a request to create a remote access session.

projectArn.documentation: The ARN of the project for the upload.

name.documentation: The upload's file name. The name should not contain the '/' character. If uploading an iOS app, the file name needs to end with the .ipa extension. If uploading an Android app, the file name needs to end with the .apk extension. For all others, the file name must end with the .zip file extension.

type.documentation:
The upload's upload type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • ANDROID_APP: An Android upload.

  • IOS_APP: An iOS upload.

  • WEB_APP: A web appliction upload.

  • EXTERNAL_DATA: An external data upload.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java JUnit test package upload.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java TestNG test package upload.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Python test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java JUnit test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java TestNG test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Python test package upload.

  • CALABASH_TEST_PACKAGE: A Calabash test package upload.

  • INSTRUMENTATION_TEST_PACKAGE: An instrumentation upload.

  • UIAUTOMATION_TEST_PACKAGE: A uiautomation test package upload.

  • UIAUTOMATOR_TEST_PACKAGE: A uiautomator test package upload.

  • XCTEST_TEST_PACKAGE: An XCode test package upload.

  • XCTEST_UI_TEST_PACKAGE: An XCode UI test package upload.

Note If you call CreateUpload with WEB_APP specified, AWS Device Farm throws an ArgumentException error.

CreateUploadRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the create upload operation.

CreateUploadResult.documentation: Represents the result of a create upload request.

arn.documentation: Represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Device Farm device pool you wish to delete.

DeleteDevicePoolRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the delete device pool operation.

DeleteDevicePoolResult.documentation: Represents the result of a delete device pool request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the network profile you want to delete.
Represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Device Farm project you wish to delete.

DeleteProjectRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the delete project operation.

DeleteProjectResult.documentation: Represents the result of a delete project request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the sesssion for which you want to delete remote access.

DeleteRemoteAccessSessionRequest.documentation: Represents the request to delete the specified remote access session.

DeleteRemoteAccessSessionResult.documentation: The response from the server when a request is made to delete the remote access session.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the run you wish to delete.

DeleteRunRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the delete run operation.

DeleteRunResult.documentation: Represents the result of a delete run request.

arn.documentation: Represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Device Farm upload you wish to delete.

DeleteUploadRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the delete upload operation.

DeleteUploadResult.documentation: Represents the result of a delete upload request.

formFactor.documentation:
The device's form factor.

Allowed values include:

  • PHONE: The phone form factor.

  • TABLET: The tablet form factor.

platform.documentation:
The device's platform.

Allowed values include:

  • ANDROID: The Android platform.

  • IOS: The iOS platform.

heapSize.documentation: The device's heap size, expressed in bytes.

memory.documentation: The device's total memory size, expressed in bytes.

remoteAccessEnabled.documentation: Specifies whether remote access has been enabled for the specified device.

fleetType.documentation: The type of fleet to which this device belongs. Possible values for fleet type are PRIVATE and PUBLIC.

fleetName.documentation: The name of the fleet to which this device belongs.

Device.documentation: Represents a device type that an app is tested against.

total.documentation: When specified, represents the total minutes used by the resource to run tests.

metered.documentation: When specified, represents only the sum of metered minutes used by the resource to run tests.

unmetered.documentation: When specified, represents only the sum of unmetered minutes used by the resource to run tests.

DeviceMinutes.documentation: Represents the total (metered or unmetered) minutes used by the resource to run tests. Contains the sum of minutes consumed by all children.

type.documentation:
The device pool's type.

Allowed values include:

  • CURATED: A device pool that is created and managed by AWS Device Farm.

  • PRIVATE: A device pool that is created and managed by the device pool developer.

device.documentation: The device (phone or tablet) that you wish to return information about.

compatible.documentation: Whether the result was compatible with the device pool.

jobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes a test run will execute before it times out.

accountsCleanup.documentation: True if account cleanup is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

appPackagesCleanup.documentation: True if app package cleanup is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

ExecutionConfiguration.documentation: Represents configuration information about a test run, such as the execution timeout (in minutes).

GetAccountSettingsRequest.documentation: Represents the request sent to retrieve the account settings.

GetAccountSettingsResult.documentation: Represents the account settings return values from the GetAccountSettings request.

appArn.documentation: The ARN of the app that is associated with the specified device pool.

testType.documentation:
The test type for the specified device pool.

Allowed values include the following:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

test.documentation: Information about the uploaded test to be run against the device pool.

GetDevicePoolCompatibilityRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get device pool compatibility operation.

GetDevicePoolCompatibilityResult.documentation: Represents the result of describe device pool compatibility request.

GetDevicePoolRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get device pool operation.

devicePool.documentation: An object containing information about the requested device pool.

GetDevicePoolResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get device pool request.

GetDeviceRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get device request.

device.documentation: An object containing information about the requested device.

GetDeviceResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get device request.

GetJobRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get job operation.

job.documentation: An object containing information about the requested job.

GetJobResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get job request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the network profile you want to return information about.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

GetOfferingStatusRequest.documentation: Represents the request to retrieve the offering status for the specified customer or account.

current.documentation: When specified, gets the offering status for the current period.

nextPeriod.documentation: When specified, gets the offering status for the next period.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

GetOfferingStatusResult.documentation: Returns the status result for a device offering.

GetProjectRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get project operation.

project.documentation: The project you wish to get information about.

GetProjectResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get project request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the remote access session about which you want to get session information.

GetRemoteAccessSessionRequest.documentation: Represents the request to get information about the specified remote access session.

remoteAccessSession.documentation: A container that lists detailed information about the remote access session.

GetRemoteAccessSessionResult.documentation: Represents the response from the server that lists detailed information about the remote access session.

GetRunRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get run operation.

run.documentation: The run you wish to get results from.

GetRunResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get run request.

GetSuiteRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get suite operation.

suite.documentation: A collection of one or more tests.

GetSuiteResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get suite request.

GetTestRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get test operation.

GetTestResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get test request.

GetUploadRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the get upload operation.

upload.documentation: An app or a set of one or more tests to upload or that have been uploaded.

GetUploadResult.documentation: Represents the result of a get upload request.

IdempotencyException.documentation: An entity with the same name already exists.

type.documentation:
The type of incompatibility.

Allowed values include:

  • ARN: The ARN.

  • FORM_FACTOR: The form factor (for example, phone or tablet).

  • MANUFACTURER: The manufacturer.

  • PLATFORM: The platform (for example, Android or iOS).

  • REMOTE_ACCESS_ENABLED: Whether the device is enabled for remote access.

  • APPIUM_VERSION: The Appium version for the test.

remoteAccessSessionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the remote access session about which you are requesting information.

appArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app about which you are requesting information.

InstallToRemoteAccessSessionRequest.documentation: Represents the request to install an Android application (in .apk format) or an iOS application (in .ipa format) as part of a remote access session.

appUpload.documentation: An app to upload or that has been uploaded.

InstallToRemoteAccessSessionResult.documentation: Represents the response from the server after AWS Device Farm makes a request to install to a remote access session.

type.documentation:
The job's type.

Allowed values include the following:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

status.documentation:
The job's status.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending status.

  • PENDING_CONCURRENCY: A pending concurrency status.

  • PENDING_DEVICE: A pending device status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SCHEDULING: A scheduling status.

  • PREPARING: A preparing status.

  • RUNNING: A running status.

  • COMPLETED: A completed status.

  • STOPPING: A stopping status.

result.documentation:
The job's result.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

deviceMinutes.documentation: Represents the total (metered or unmetered) minutes used by the job.

arn.documentation: The Run, Job, Suite, or Test ARN.

type.documentation:
The artifacts' type.

Allowed values include:

  • FILE: The artifacts are files.

  • LOG: The artifacts are logs.

  • SCREENSHOT: The artifacts are screenshots.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListArtifactsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list artifacts operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListArtifactsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list artifacts operation.

type.documentation:
The device pools' type.

Allowed values include:

  • CURATED: A device pool that is created and managed by AWS Device Farm.

  • PRIVATE: A device pool that is created and managed by the device pool developer.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListDevicePoolsRequest.documentation: Represents the result of a list device pools request.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListDevicePoolsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list device pools request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListDevicesRequest.documentation: Represents the result of a list devices request.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListDevicesResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list devices operation.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListJobsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list jobs operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListJobsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list jobs request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to list network profiles.

type.documentation: The type of network profile you wish to return information about. Valid values are listed below.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

networkProfiles.documentation: A list of the available network profiles.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier to be used in the next call to this operation, to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListOfferingTransactionsRequest.documentation: Represents the request to list the offering transaction history.

offeringTransactions.documentation: The audit log of subscriptions you have purchased and modified through AWS Device Farm.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListOfferingTransactionsResult.documentation: Returns the transaction log of the specified offerings.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListOfferingsRequest.documentation: Represents the request to list all offerings.

offerings.documentation: A value representing the list offering results.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListOfferingsResult.documentation: Represents the return values of the list of offerings.

arn.documentation: Optional. If no Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is specified, then AWS Device Farm returns a list of all projects for the AWS account. You can also specify a project ARN.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListProjectsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list projects operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListProjectsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list projects request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the remote access session about which you are requesting information.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListRemoteAccessSessionsRequest.documentation: Represents the request to return information about the remote access session.

remoteAccessSessions.documentation: A container representing the metadata from the service about each remote access session you are requesting.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListRemoteAccessSessionsResult.documentation: Represents the response from the server after AWS Device Farm makes a request to return information about the remote access session.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to list runs.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListRunsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list runs operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListRunsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list runs request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to list samples.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListSamplesRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list samples operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListSamplesResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list samples request.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListSuitesRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list suites operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListSuitesResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list suites request.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListTestsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list tests operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListTestsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list tests request.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListUniqueProblemsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list unique problems operation.

uniqueProblems.documentation:
Information about the unique problems.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListUniqueProblemsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list unique problems request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project for which you want to list uploads.

nextToken.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.

ListUploadsRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the list uploads operation.

nextToken.documentation: If the number of items that are returned is significantly large, this is an identifier that is also returned, which can be used in a subsequent call to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

ListUploadsResult.documentation: Represents the result of a list uploads request.

Location.documentation:
Represents a latitude and longitude pair, expressed in geographic coordinate system degrees (for example 47.6204, -122.3491).

Elevation is currently not supported.

amount.documentation: The numerical amount of an offering or transaction.

currencyCode.documentation: The currency code of a monetary amount. For example, USD means "U.S. dollars."

MonetaryAmount.documentation: A number representing the monetary amount for an offering or transaction.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the network profile.

type.documentation: The type of network profile. Valid values are listed below.

uplinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

downlinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

uplinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of transmitted packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

downlinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of received packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

NetworkProfile.documentation: An array of settings that describes characteristics of a network profile.

message.documentation: The HTTP response code of a Not Eligible exception.

NotEligibleException.documentation: Exception gets thrown when a user is not eligible to perform the specified transaction.

id.documentation: The ID that corresponds to a device offering.

type.documentation: The type of offering (e.g., "RECURRING") for a device.

platform.documentation: The platform of the device (e.g., ANDROID or IOS).

recurringCharges.documentation: Specifies whether there are recurring charges for the offering.

Offering.documentation: Represents the metadata of a device offering.

type.documentation: The type specified for the offering status.

offering.documentation: Represents the metadata of an offering status.

quantity.documentation: The number of available devices in the offering.

effectiveOn.documentation: The date on which the offering is effective.

transactionId.documentation: The transaction ID of the offering transaction.

offeringPromotionId.documentation: The ID that corresponds to a device offering promotion.

createdOn.documentation: The date on which an offering transaction was created.

OfferingTransaction.documentation: Represents the metadata of an offering transaction.

result.documentation:
The problem's result.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

defaultJobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The default number of minutes (at the project level) a test run will execute before it times out. Default value is 60 minutes.

Project.documentation: Represents an operating-system neutral workspace for running and managing tests.

quantity.documentation: The number of device slots you wish to purchase in an offering request.

offeringPromotionId.documentation: The ID of the offering promotion to be applied to the purchase.

PurchaseOfferingRequest.documentation: Represents a request for a purchase offering.

offeringTransaction.documentation: Represents the offering transaction for the purchase result.

PurchaseOfferingResult.documentation: The result of the purchase offering (e.g., success or failure).

wifi.documentation: True if Wi-Fi is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

bluetooth.documentation: True if Bluetooth is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

nfc.documentation: True if NFC is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

gps.documentation: True if GPS is enabled at the beginning of the test; otherwise, false.

Radios.documentation: Represents the set of radios and their states on a device. Examples of radios include Wi-Fi, GPS, Bluetooth, and NFC.

frequency.documentation: The frequency in which charges will recur.

RecurringCharge.documentation: Specifies whether charges for devices will be recurring.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the remote access session.

name.documentation: The name of the remote access session.

created.documentation: The date and time the remote access session was created.

status.documentation:
The status of the remote access session. Can be any of the following:

  • PENDING: A pending status.

  • PENDING_CONCURRENCY: A pending concurrency status.

  • PENDING_DEVICE: A pending device status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SCHEDULING: A scheduling status.

  • PREPARING: A preparing status.

  • RUNNING: A running status.

  • COMPLETED: A completed status.

  • STOPPING: A stopping status.

result.documentation:
The result of the remote access session. Can be any of the following:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

message.documentation: A message about the remote access session.

started.documentation: The date and time the remote access session was started.

stopped.documentation: The date and time the remote access session was stopped.

device.documentation: The device (phone or tablet) used in the remote access session.

billingMethod.documentation: The billing method of the remote access session. Possible values include METERED or UNMETERED. For more information about metered devices, see AWS Device Farm terminology."

deviceMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes a device is used in a remote access sesssion (including setup and teardown minutes).

endpoint.documentation: The endpoint for the remote access sesssion.

RemoteAccessSession.documentation: Represents information about the remote access session.

offeringId.documentation: The ID of a request to renew an offering.

quantity.documentation: The quantity requested in an offering renewal.

offeringTransaction.documentation: Represents the status of the offering transaction for the renewal.

width.documentation: The screen resolution's width, expressed in pixels.

height.documentation: The screen resolution's height, expressed in pixels.

Resolution.documentation: Represents the screen resolution of a device in height and width, expressed in pixels.

attribute.documentation:
The rule's stringified attribute. For example, specify the value as "\"abc\"".

Allowed values include:

  • ARN: The ARN.

  • FORM_FACTOR: The form factor (for example, phone or tablet).

  • MANUFACTURER: The manufacturer.

  • PLATFORM: The platform (for example, Android or iOS).

  • REMOTE_ACCESS_ENABLED: Whether the device is enabled for remote access.

  • APPIUM_VERSION: The Appium version for the test.

operator.documentation:
The rule's operator.

  • EQUALS: The equals operator.

  • GREATER_THAN: The greater-than operator.

  • IN: The in operator.

  • LESS_THAN: The less-than operator.

  • NOT_IN: The not-in operator.

  • CONTAINS: The contains operator.

Rule.documentation: Represents a condition for a device pool.

type.documentation:
The run's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

platform.documentation:
The run's platform.

Allowed values include:

  • ANDROID: The Android platform.

  • IOS: The iOS platform.

status.documentation:
The run's status.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending status.

  • PENDING_CONCURRENCY: A pending concurrency status.

  • PENDING_DEVICE: A pending device status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SCHEDULING: A scheduling status.

  • PREPARING: A preparing status.

  • RUNNING: A running status.

  • COMPLETED: A completed status.

  • STOPPING: A stopping status.

result.documentation:
The run's result.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

totalJobs.documentation: The total number of jobs for the run.

billingMethod.documentation: Specifies the billing method for a test run: metered or unmetered. If the parameter is not specified, the default value is metered.

deviceMinutes.documentation: Represents the total (metered or unmetered) minutes used by the test run.

networkProfile.documentation: The network profile being used for a test run.

Run.documentation: Represents an app on a set of devices with a specific test and configuration.

type.documentation:
The sample's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • CPU: A CPU sample type. This is expressed as the app processing CPU time (including child processes) as reported by process, as a percentage.

  • MEMORY: A memory usage sample type. This is expressed as the total proportional set size of an app process, in kilobytes.

  • NATIVE_AVG_DRAWTIME

  • NATIVE_FPS

  • NATIVE_FRAMES

  • NATIVE_MAX_DRAWTIME

  • NATIVE_MIN_DRAWTIME

  • OPENGL_AVG_DRAWTIME

  • OPENGL_FPS

  • OPENGL_FRAMES

  • OPENGL_MAX_DRAWTIME

  • OPENGL_MIN_DRAWTIME

  • RX

  • RX_RATE: The total number of bytes per second (TCP and UDP) that are sent, by app process.

  • THREADS: A threads sample type. This is expressed as the total number of threads per app process.

  • TX

  • TX_RATE: The total number of bytes per second (TCP and UDP) that are received, by app process.

url.documentation: The pre-signed Amazon S3 URL that can be used with a corresponding GET request to download the sample's file.

extraDataPackageArn.documentation: The ARN of the extra data for the run. The extra data is a .zip file that AWS Device Farm will extract to external data for Android or the app's sandbox for iOS.

locale.documentation: Information about the locale that is used for the run.

location.documentation: Information about the location that is used for the run.

radios.documentation: Information about the radio states for the run.

auxiliaryApps.documentation: A list of auxiliary apps for the run.

billingMethod.documentation: Specifies the billing method for a test run: metered or unmetered. If the parameter is not specified, the default value is metered.

ScheduleRunConfiguration.documentation: Represents the settings for a run. Includes things like location, radio states, auxiliary apps, and network profiles.

projectArn.documentation: The ARN of the project for the run to be scheduled.

appArn.documentation: The ARN of the app to schedule a run.

devicePoolArn.documentation: The ARN of the device pool for the run to be scheduled.

name.documentation: The name for the run to be scheduled.

test.documentation: Information about the test for the run to be scheduled.

configuration.documentation: Information about the settings for the run to be scheduled.

executionConfiguration.documentation: Specifies configuration information about a test run, such as the execution timeout (in minutes).

ScheduleRunRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the schedule run operation.

ScheduleRunResult.documentation: Represents the result of a schedule run request.

type.documentation:
The test's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

testPackageArn.documentation: The ARN of the uploaded test that will be run.

parameters.documentation:
The test's parameters, such as the following test framework parameters and fixture settings:

For Calabash tests:

  • profile: A cucumber profile, for example, "my_profile_name".

  • tags: You can limit execution to features or scenarios that have (or don't have) certain tags, for example, "@smoke" or "@smoke,~@wip".

For Appium tests (all types):

  • appium_version: The Appium version. Currently supported values are "1.4.16", "1.6.3", "latest", and "default".

    • latest will run the latest Appium version supported by Device Farm (1.6.3).

    • For default, Device Farm will choose a compatible version of Appium for the device. The current behavior is to run 1.4.16 on Android devices and iOS 9 and earlier, 1.6.3 for iOS 10 and later.

    • This behavior is subject to change.

For Fuzz tests (Android only):

  • event_count: The number of events, between 1 and 10000, that the UI fuzz test should perform.

  • throttle: The time, in ms, between 0 and 1000, that the UI fuzz test should wait between events.

  • seed: A seed to use for randomizing the UI fuzz test. Using the same seed value between tests ensures identical event sequences.

For Explorer tests:

  • username: A username to use if the Explorer encounters a login form. If not supplied, no username will be inserted.

  • password: A password to use if the Explorer encounters a login form. If not supplied, no password will be inserted.

For Instrumentation:

  • filter: A test filter string. Examples:

    • Running a single test case: "com.android.abc.Test1"

    • Running a single test: "com.android.abc.Test1#smoke"

    • Running multiple tests: "com.android.abc.Test1,com.android.abc.Test2"

For XCTest and XCTestUI:

  • filter: A test filter string. Examples:

    • Running a single test class: "LoginTests"

    • Running a multiple test classes: "LoginTests,SmokeTests"

    • Running a single test: "LoginTests/testValid"

    • Running multiple tests: "LoginTests/testValid,LoginTests/testInvalid"

For UIAutomator:

  • filter: A test filter string. Examples:

    • Running a single test case: "com.android.abc.Test1"

    • Running a single test: "com.android.abc.Test1#smoke"

    • Running multiple tests: "com.android.abc.Test1,com.android.abc.Test2"

ServiceAccountException.documentation: There was a problem with the service account.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the remote access session you wish to stop.

StopRemoteAccessSessionRequest.documentation: Represents the request to stop the remote access session.

remoteAccessSession.documentation: A container representing the metadata from the service about the remote access session you are stopping.

StopRemoteAccessSessionResult.documentation: Represents the response from the server that describes the remote access session when AWS Device Farm stops the session.

arn.documentation: Represents the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Device Farm run you wish to stop.

StopRunRequest.documentation: Represents the request to stop a specific run.

StopRunResult.documentation: Represents the results of your stop run attempt.

type.documentation:
The suite's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

status.documentation:
The suite's status.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending status.

  • PENDING_CONCURRENCY: A pending concurrency status.

  • PENDING_DEVICE: A pending device status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SCHEDULING: A scheduling status.

  • PREPARING: A preparing status.

  • RUNNING: A running status.

  • COMPLETED: A completed status.

  • STOPPING: A stopping status.

result.documentation:
The suite's result.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

deviceMinutes.documentation: Represents the total (metered or unmetered) minutes used by the test suite.

Suite.documentation: Represents a collection of one or more tests.

type.documentation:
The test's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • BUILTIN_FUZZ: The built-in fuzz type.

  • BUILTIN_EXPLORER: For Android, an app explorer that will traverse an Android app, interacting with it and capturing screenshots at the same time.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON: The Appium Python type.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT: The Appium Java JUnit type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG: The Appium Java TestNG type for Web apps.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON: The Appium Python type for Web apps.

  • CALABASH: The Calabash type.

  • INSTRUMENTATION: The Instrumentation type.

  • UIAUTOMATION: The uiautomation type.

  • UIAUTOMATOR: The uiautomator type.

  • XCTEST: The XCode test type.

  • XCTEST_UI: The XCode UI test type.

status.documentation:
The test's status.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending status.

  • PENDING_CONCURRENCY: A pending concurrency status.

  • PENDING_DEVICE: A pending device status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SCHEDULING: A scheduling status.

  • PREPARING: A preparing status.

  • RUNNING: A running status.

  • COMPLETED: A completed status.

  • STOPPING: A stopping status.

result.documentation:
The test's result.

Allowed values include:

  • PENDING: A pending condition.

  • PASSED: A passing condition.

  • WARNED: A warning condition.

  • FAILED: A failed condition.

  • SKIPPED: A skipped condition.

  • ERRORED: An error condition.

  • STOPPED: A stopped condition.

deviceMinutes.documentation: Represents the total (metered or unmetered) minutes used by the test.

total.documentation: The total number of free trial minutes that the account started with.

remaining.documentation: The number of free trial minutes remaining in the account.

TrialMinutes.documentation: Represents information about free trial device minutes for an AWS account.

message.documentation: A message about the unique problems' result.

UniqueProblem.documentation: A collection of one or more problems, grouped by their result.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resourc Name (ARN) of the Device Farm device pool you wish to update.

name.documentation: A string representing the name of the device pool you wish to update.

description.documentation: A description of the device pool you wish to update.

rules.documentation: Represents the rules you wish to modify for the device pool. Updating rules is optional; however, if you choose to update rules for your request, the update will replace the existing rules.

UpdateDevicePoolRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the update device pool operation.

UpdateDevicePoolResult.documentation: Represents the result of an update device pool request.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project that you wish to update network profile settings.

name.documentation: The name of the network profile about which you are returning information.

description.documentation: The descriptoin of the network profile about which you are returning information.

type.documentation: The type of network profile you wish to return information about. Valid values are listed below.

uplinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

downlinkBandwidthBits.documentation: The data throughput rate in bits per second, as an integer from 0 to 104857600.

uplinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkDelayMs.documentation: Delay time for all packets to destination in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

downlinkJitterMs.documentation: Time variation in the delay of received packets in milliseconds as an integer from 0 to 2000.

uplinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of transmitted packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

downlinkLossPercent.documentation: Proportion of received packets that fail to arrive from 0 to 100 percent.

networkProfile.documentation: A list of the available network profiles.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project whose name you wish to update.

name.documentation: A string representing the new name of the project that you are updating.

defaultJobTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes a test run in the project will execute before it times out.

UpdateProjectRequest.documentation: Represents a request to the update project operation.

UpdateProjectResult.documentation: Represents the result of an update project request.

type.documentation:
The upload's type.

Must be one of the following values:

  • ANDROID_APP: An Android upload.

  • IOS_APP: An iOS upload.

  • WEB_APP: A web appliction upload.

  • EXTERNAL_DATA: An external data upload.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_JUNIT_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java JUnit test package upload.

  • APPIUM_JAVA_TESTNG_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java TestNG test package upload.

  • APPIUM_PYTHON_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Python test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_JUNIT_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java JUnit test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_JAVA_TESTNG_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Java TestNG test package upload.

  • APPIUM_WEB_PYTHON_TEST_PACKAGE: An Appium Python test package upload.

  • CALABASH_TEST_PACKAGE: A Calabash test package upload.

  • INSTRUMENTATION_TEST_PACKAGE: An instrumentation upload.

  • UIAUTOMATION_TEST_PACKAGE: A uiautomation test package upload.

  • UIAUTOMATOR_TEST_PACKAGE: A uiautomator test package upload.

  • XCTEST_TEST_PACKAGE: An XCode test package upload.

  • XCTEST_UI_TEST_PACKAGE: An XCode UI test package upload.

status.documentation:
The upload's status.

Must be one of the following values:

  • FAILED: A failed status.

  • INITIALIZED: An initialized status.

  • PROCESSING: A processing status.

  • SUCCEEDED: A succeeded status.

url.documentation: The pre-signed Amazon S3 URL that was used to store a file through a corresponding PUT request.

metadata.documentation: The upload's metadata. For example, for Android, this contains information that is parsed from the manifest and is displayed in the AWS Device Farm console after the associated app is uploaded.

Upload.documentation: An app or a set of one or more tests to upload or that have been uploaded.

documentation: AWS Device Farm is a service that enables mobile app developers to test Android, iOS, and Fire OS apps on physical phones, tablets, and other devices in the cloud.
